title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 25 August 2012 - XWiki
content:
02:31 <tekzilla> has quit  
02:32 <tekzilla> has joined #xwiki

20:24 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
20:58 <@sdumitriu> vmassol: When receiving an ApplicationStoppedEvent, there's no execution context. Is that by design?  
20:59 <ssavi> has quit  
21:08 <vmassol> sdumitriu: hmm I don't remember but I think it's because it's not needed, the EC can also be injected through @Inject Execution execution  
21:08 <vmassol> (passing the xwikicontext everywhere is the old design)  
21:09 <vmassol> hmm maybe I'm wrong  
21:09 <vmassol> don't know really, would need to think a bit more to not say stupid things… :)  
21:13 <coud> has quit  
21:19 <@sdumitriu> I have the Execution, but calling execution.getContext() returns null  
21:20 <@sdumitriu> Since the context stack is null  
21:23 <@sdumitriu> Nobody calls setContext since that's not a request thread, it's the main thread that responded to the Ctrl+C on the command line  
21:26 <ries\_> has joined #xwiki  
21:32 <ries\_> has quit  
21:58 <ries> has joined #xwiki  
23:04 <ssavi> has joined #xwiki
